script.zh: 她说那个晚饭"无聊"。无聊！我从来没被人说无聊。我是那个每天晚上出去的人。我是fun guy。
script.en: She said the dinner was "boring." Boring! Nobody's ever called me boring. I'm the guy who goes out every night. I'm the fun guy.

script.zh: 你在酒吧很fun。跟觉得你中文差很cute的中国女生在一起很fun。但小李是半美国人的。她不会觉得你的外国人身份有什么特别。
script.en: You're fun at bars. Fun around Chinese girls who think your bad Chinese is cute. But 小李 is half American. She's not gonna think your foreigner status is anything special.

script.zh: 你的整个人设。你在中国很自信因为你是白人。在中国当白人有bonus。但小李面前你没有这个bonus。她让你觉得你回到了Ohio。
script.en: Your whole persona. You're confident in China because you're white. Being white in China comes with a bonus. But in front of 小李 you don't have that bonus. She makes you feel like you're back in Ohio.

script.zh: 她真的好好看。No cap。但是我在她面前说不出话来。脑子直接关机。只会说"那……你喜欢火锅吗？"像机器人一样。
script.en: She's so pretty though. No cap. But I can't say anything in front of her. Brain just shuts down. All I can say is "so... do you like hot pot?" Like a robot.

script.zh: 所以你喜欢她因为她漂亮又得不到。
script.en: So you like her because she's pretty and you can't have her.
...That's a harsh way to put it.

script.zh: 你呢？你想过女生吗？还是只想台湾？
script.en: What about you? Ever think about girls? Or just Taiwan?

script.zh: 她每天请你喝奶茶。她跟你吵台湾的事就是为了让你跟她说话。
script.en: She buys you boba every day. She argues with you about Taiwan just to get you to talk to her.

script.zh: 她吵是因为她不同意我的观点。
script.en: She argues because she disagrees with me.

script.zh: 她吵是因为那是唯一能让你注意到她的方式。她一个广东女生才不会半夜看两岸关系的文章。她半夜在想你。
script.en: She argues because it's the only way to get you to notice her. A Cantonese girl is not reading cross-strait relations articles at midnight. She's up thinking about you.

script.text: 他们休息了。坐在bench上。矮中看到了远处的怪老师——在校园咖啡厅附近跟一个年轻中国女生聊天。倾身向前、笑、碰手臂。
script.en: They take a break. Sitting on a bench. 矮中 spots 怪老师 in the distance -- near the campus coffee shop, chatting up a young Chinese girl. Leaning in, laughing, touching her arm.

script.zh: 他在做跟我在酒吧做的一模一样的事。身体前倾。笑。买饮料。
script.en: He's doing the exact same thing I do at bars. Leaning in. Laughing. Buying drinks.

script.zh: 他四十多岁了，在跟一个看起来二十岁的女生聊天。
script.en: He's in his forties, chatting up a girl who looks twenty.

script.zh: 他在做跟你一模一样的事。只是他做了十五年了。而且已经不charming了。只是sad了。
script.en: He's doing the exact same thing as you. Except he's been doing it for fifteen years. And it's not charming anymore. It's just sad.

script.text: Ch 10: 觉得 vs 认为
script.en: Ch 10: 觉得 vs 认为

script.text: 在亚洲，一些在自己国家不太受欢迎的西方男性会突然变得"有魅力"。因为外国人身份本身就是一个novelty。矮中在Ohio是5分，在中国是7分——他自己说的。但在小李面前（半白半中国），这个bonus消失了。王崩一针见血。
script.en: In Asia, some Western men who aren't popular back home suddenly become "charming." Being foreign is itself a novelty. 矮中 is a 5 in Ohio, a 7 in China -- his own words. But in front of 小李 (half white, half Chinese), that bonus vanishes. 王崩 nailed it.

vocab.note: 约人 = to ask someone out

grammarNotes.title: 觉得 vs 认为
grammarNotes.body:
觉得 = personal feeling. 我觉得她很漂亮。
认为 = more formal opinion. 我认为这不对。
Daily speech: 觉得 is used 99% of the time.

grammarNotes.title: 虽然...但是...
grammarNotes.body:
虽然他很烦，但是他很自信。= Although he's annoying, he's confident.
虽然她说"还行"，但是她不开心。= Although she said "fine," she's not happy.

cultureNotes.title: AA vs 请客
cultureNotes.body: 中国文化里传统上是一个人请客（pay for everyone）。年轻一代越来越AA（split the bill）。矮中和小李AA了——这说明那顿饭不是约会。如果他请客了，意味不同。
